attributes.action: Not Increase the proposed Fees for Visa Applicants who wish to make an Application for Indefinate Leave to Remain
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
At present the Fees to make an application as the Spouse of a British Resident in the UK is £335 for a Postal Application and a Premium application £500. It has been proposed to increase this to £750 for a Postal Application and £950 for a Premium

The fees charged are at a reasonable rate already and there is no solid justification for nearly doubling the amount to charge and pass it off as "a way to set fees at levels that minimise the operational risk to Home Office businesses whilst generating the revenue for the next four years to help fund the transformation of the immigration system." 

Why should people who want to stay in the UK as Spouses pay for the future of the immigration with so much of their hard earned salary when they are not already allowed access to public funds and in some circumstances treated as second rate citizens until they have their indefinite leave to remain?

For someone on £14000 a year thats 65% of their monthly income bofore tax has been deducted. Surely this is a stealth tax that should be stopped. Don't increase the fees for this specific application.
